text.__SUMMARY__: Thurston's worm snake (Gerrhopilus thurstoni) is a harmless blind snake species found in western India. No subspecies are currently recognized.
text.Etymology: The specific name, thurstoni, is in honor of British zoologist Edgar Thurston.
text.Geographic range: In western India, it has been found in southern Goa, from sea level to approximately 1,200 m elevation (4,000 feet), and in Kerala.The type locality given is "Nilgiri Hills, Brit. Ostindien ".
text.External links: Gerrhopilus thurstoni at the Reptarium.cz Reptile Database. Accessed 7 April 2017.
